result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin Claudio was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs by 10.31.16 or, if not paid, a civil judgment is ordered. 
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges by 10.31.16 or, if not paid, a civil judgment is ordered.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Benjamin Claudio

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Benjamin Claudio in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Defendant Benjamin Claudio in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Statements made as to sentencing.  
The Court sentenced the defendant to 12 MONTHS in the House of Correction with credit for 199 days time served.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs by 10.31.16 or, if not paid, a civil judgment is ordered. 
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges by 10.31.16 or, if not paid, a civil judgment is ordered. 
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Judgement of Conviction.

Attorney Colin P. McGinn in court, defendant Benjamin Claudio not in court, in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel miscalendared today's date and is not able to proceed to sentencing today. Matter is adjourned. If matter does is not completed on next date, matter to be reassigned per Chief Judge Directive 15-19.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Benjamin Claudio in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Defendant Benjamin Claudio in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense is no longer pursuing motion.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms or body armor. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Defendant is ordered REMANDED pending sentencing date.
Jury trial date of 12/7/15 is vacated.
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

Defendant Benjamin Claudio in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Defendant Benjamin Claudio in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense is withdrawing speedy trial demand. Defense plans to file Daubert motion, matter is in trial posture.  Motion hearing scheduled for October 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for December 7, 2015 at 09:30 am.
State's Motion in Limine/State's Witness List/State's Requested Jury Instructions, filed.

Defendant Benjamin Claudio in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Defendant Benjamin Claudio in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel states matter is not able to proceed to trial today, Court hears argument. Court is not able to try this case today, Court to procced to jury trial in another matter. Court orders matter adjourned for motion hearing on 8/20/15 at 8:30am in Br. 35.  Motion hearing scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Benjamin Claudio in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Defendant Benjamin Claudio in custody.  Antonella Aleman for Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court hears argument. Court orders motion hearing adjourned to trial date. 
Matter remains scheduled for jury trial on 8/17/15 at 9:30am in Br. 35.
- to exclude expert testimony and second motion to compel discovery, filed.
Original Transcript (18 pages) MOTION TO DISMISS commencing JULY 22, 2015 received and filed.

Defendant Benjamin Claudio in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Defendant Benjamin Claudio in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State requests an adjournment.  Court grants adjournment and continues case for 30 days.   Court ordered case adjourned for jury trial in Branch 7.   All parties notified as of August 03, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35, in room 629 of the courthouse.
Defendant's Motion to Exclude Expert Testimony and Defendant's Custodial Interrogation and Motion to Compel Discovery.

Defendant Benjamin Claudio in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Defendant Benjamin Claudio in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case still in trial posture.  A Daubert Hearing will be heard on the day of trial.
Defendant's Requested Jury Instructions and Motion in Limine.

Attorney Colin P. McGinn in court, defendant Benjamin Claudio not in court, in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND on behalf of the defendant.   Case adjourned for final pretrial on 7.8.15 and for jury trial on 7.22.15.  Final pre-trial scheduled for 07-08-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Benjamin Claudio in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Defendant Benjamin Claudio in custody.  Nathaniel Adamson for Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Thomas McAdams, Branch 07.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 07.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Benjamin Claudio in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Defendant Benjamin Claudio in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge McAdams, Branch 7.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Benjamin Claudio
Current: 1229 S 25th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53204   (Effective: 04-21-2015)
Prior: 725 South 21st Street, Milwaukee, WI 53204
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
